abstract.p: Dr Joel J Nobel letter on July 2 article holds journalists become paid advertisements when they accept free services from plastic surgeons1

block.p: ''Doctors Who Love Publicity'' (July 2) reveals how plastic surgeons give free services to beauty and health writers in return for prominent mention in top magazines in order to attract paying patients. This is an appalling breach of professional ethics. Individual journalists are, in effect, ''paid'' for advertising placements by greedy physicians. Naive, vanity-driven trendy readers are conned. What a horrendous set of human values. All three parties deserve each other. But it should have been headed ''Doctors Bribe Narcissistic Journalists.''
JOEL J. NOBEL, M.D. Plymouth Meeting, Pa.
